intro: Crotalaria cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf crownflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed areas. Its seeds are enclosed in a pod and can remain viable in the soil for several years. Crotalaria cuneifolia is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial in certain ecological contexts.
